revised_title: The Significance of Leader-Stroke Velocity in Lightning and Long Sparks
tldr: The authors studied the velocities of stepped leader-strokes in lightning flashes and found that they vary by a factor greater than 20:1. They suggest that faster lightning leaders are driven by an over-voltage created by discharges in the cloud before the visible part of the leader emerges below the cloud. The authors tested various electrode arrangements and impulse sparkover voltages to observe the differences in behavior as leader-stroke velocities increased, which could help improve understanding of lightning currents and their effects on transmission lines.
